clinical_study.brief_title: Laparoscopic Sleeve Gastrectomy vs Laparoscopic Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Laparoscopic Sleeve Gastrectomy vs Laparoscopic Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass on Weight Loss in Patients With Morbid Obesity

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective work on 200 morbid obese patients randomized and categorized into 2 groups according to the treatment method: the laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy (LSG) and LRYGB groups, within the period from 2014 to 2019 and matched weight dissipation, complications, life quality, and negative events

primary_outcome.description: decrease the body mass index by 1 or more

intervention.description: Bougie was applied over the lower curvature to adjust the gastric tube then longitudinal amputation of the stomach was performed for about 4 to 6 cm per pecker of the pylorus to the corner of His. No supportive materials were used, and over-suturing of the basic line performed only over the points of bleeding. All resected specimens were sent to histopathology laboratory for examination.

study_pop.textblock: Study included Egyptian patients with age ranging from 18 to 70 seeking surgical operation for obesity.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients of (Body Mass Index) more than 40, with at least 1 comorbidity
Exclusion Criteria:
- All patients of (Body Mass Index) less than 40,
- No comorbidities
- Patients who refused the surgical procedures.
